intro: Melampyrum saxosum var. javorkae, commonly known as the Javorka yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This variety is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant's botanical features reflect its adaptation to harsh, nutrient-poor environments.
